header: Seeking a leadership role focused on sustainable engineering and management.
footer: Don’t hesitate to contact me if you need further information, let’s cooperate

data.header: Seeking a leadership role focused on sustainable engineering and management.
description: Bringing over a decade of diverse engineering experience, I excel in automation, failure analysis, and risk assessment. With a unique ability to bridge technical and business domains, I'm recognized for my exceptional communication skills and commitment to innovation.
As a self-motivated individual and a valuable team player, I am deeply committed to advancing green engineering solutions with efficiency and precision.

content.subheader: in Mechanical Engineering (MSME) - University of South Florida, Tampa, FL - 2020
list: Conducted research on 4D Printing, Shape Memory Effect in Polymers and Alloys, Soft Robotics and Assistive Devices
Implemented origami and kirigami techniques into 3D and 4D printed soft robotic components
Mentored five masters and undergraduate students in the lab and a 4-person capstone design team

content.subheader: in Mechanical Engineering (BSME) - University of South Florida, Tampa, FL - 2017
list: Experienced in Laser cutting, 3D printing, Computer-Aided Design, and Finite Element Modeling
Trained in lab work, tag out lock out regulations, and safety-first prioritization while gaining a hands-on experience

content.subheader: in Engineering (AA) - Bucks County Community College, Newtown, PA - 2014
list: Co-founder of the Society of Bucks Engineers, the first professional engineering society on campus
Established a competition between neighboring colleges for various drone applicationsf

content.subheader: STMicroelectronics, Inc., Fremont, CA - February 2022 to September 2023
list: Managed a newly-functional, chemically-intensive R&D laboratory, focusing on safety aspects like rule creation, program development, competency training, hazard assessment, chemical and waste management, equipment maintenance, and the shipping and receiving of Dangerous Goods (DG). Ensured adherence to DOT & IATA shipping procedures, for domestic & international shipments.

Maintained strict compliance with numerous regulations, encompassing federal, state, local, and corporate levels. This included recordkeeping, reporting, inspections and audits, in alignment with standards set by bodies like OSHA, EPA, DEA, and more.

Developed and implemented comprehensive safety programs and protocols such as the Emergency Action Plan, Injury and Illness Prevention Plan, Hazard Communication, and Waste Management Plan. Increased employee safety by implementing a myriad of safety features such as an Emergency Response Team, strategically placed walkie-talkies and signs, additional sensors and alarms, and evacuation drills.

Oversaw the lifecycle of chemicals from entry to exit, implementing rigorous management practices and providing specialized training to employees. Enacted strict measures like spill containment, scrubbers on air vents, and filters to maintain a safe working environment.

Initiated the implementation of ISO9001 and IATF16949 quality standards across the site, conducting a thorough gap analysis and formulating a plan of action. Collaboratively built knowledge and expertise to overcome the challenge of the team lacking prior experience with ISO standards.

content.subheader: University of South Florida, Tampa, FL - November 2017 to August 2021
list: Responsible for design, manufacturing, and testing of multiple active and passive robots for ADLs based on customer needs, disabilities, and specific User Requirement Specifications (URS)

Established product development plans, manufacturing strategy, timelines, milestones, and deliverables; determined key partners, activities, resources, cost structure, revenue streams, and value propositions; performed risk assessments; conducted FMEAs and statistical analysis for prototype performance

Researched novel corona-discharge-based sterilization techniques; developed smart stimuli-responsive materials; designed origami-based soft robots for energy harvesting, humidity sensing, and 4D printing; increased polymer film production by 10 times

content.subheader: University of South Florida, Tampa, FL - January 2018 to May 2021
list: Educated undergraduate and graduate students in key concepts of courses including Machine Design, Mechanical Engineering Lab, Capstone Design, Mechanics of Materials, and Applied Elasticity

Mentored students one-on-one to identify weaknesses and close gaps in their understanding of the material; organized and led live problem-solving sessions to help students connect theory with real-world problems; seamlessly adjusted to a COVID-era instruction environment

Effectively communicated expectations to students; followed up with professors and advisors to ensure complex theories were demonstrated in innovative and consistent ways; proactively initiated contact with underachieving students to safeguard progress throughout the semester

content.subheader: University of Science and Technology, Beijing, China - May 2017 to August 2018
list: Collaborated with multi-functional teams to generate groundbreaking concepts in creative and innovative ways; experimented with the manufacturing of novel superconductors via Hydrogen embrittlement of a finely polished Iron-alloy

Provided expertise for numerous manuscripts on data analysis, charts and figures, flow, organization, grammar, submission quality; directly influenced a number of publications which have been released in renowned metallic, magnetic, and polymer-based journals

Assimilated quickly into the Chinese culture including purchasing a vehicle and making local friends; prioritized between multiple simultaneous projects across 3 universities, each in their own respective cities

content.subheader: Medcomp Inc, Harleysville, PA - May 2016 to August 2016
list: Performed design verification and validation of various medical devices; sorted through archives of data to determine relevancy of documentation for currently modified product lines
Assisted engineers on conducting FMEAs; performed failure testing for batch samples of high-volume products including tensile, bending, pressure, and time degradation/aging

Designed and facilitated the production of several new tools and tool fixtures; utilized injection molding for production and subsequent assembly of new devices; verified IQ/OQ/PQ was conducted properly on new tools
Developed an SOP for QA to test zero-clearance gaps in dilators following ISO standards; verified test results for consistency across various internal and competitors’ product lines

content.header: 4D Printed Soft Robotics and Energy Harvesters
list: Created a polymer solution which can be used as an ink with 4D inkjet/polyjet printing
Drew inspiration from nature to create a multi-material soft robot which can self actuate when exposed to water or humidity
Implemented traditional origami and kirigami techniques to allow for pre-determined shape change
Drafted a senior design project for undergraduate students based on this research

content.header: Cold Plasma Sterilization and Static Recharge Devices
list: Designed multiple devices to sterilize surfaces by using cold plasma generated from a high voltage corona discharge
Handheld device is primarily 3D printed and features a removable battery, a transformer, and a tungsten needle
Enclosed device is designed for rapid face masks sterilization and recharge using conductive polymer and ultra-thin tungsten wire
Featured in local media including Bay News 9, ABC Action News, 83 degrees media, USF Newsroom, and News Channel 8
Hacking for Defense (H4D) initiative project sponsored by the Naval Surface Warfare Center in Crane, IN (NSWC Crane)
Interviewed numerous active and retired military personnel to understand the full breaching process and associated risks
Built the Mission Model Canvas, iterated the value proposition, & pivoted the problem to reflect the real issues being faced
Presented a minimum viable product (MVP) to beneficiaries and stakeholders with cost and 3-year technical readiness timeline
Segmented an image into foreground objects, each uniquely shaded, and background with matching shading
Tracked objects in a continuous video, displaying dots around each object as it moves across the screen
User could select and replace any part of an image with a different image scaled to fit the selected area
Utilized deep-learning to visually recognize activities of daily life (ADLs) with a goal to teach an assistant robot to repeat them
Designed an armrest-device to assist individuals with atrophied arm muscles to reach objects, especially those on high shelves
Entirely passive with solely an elastic band to activate vertical actuation, no electrical or power components
Three degrees of freedom (Dof): Vertical, to lift arm; Horizontal, to reach forward; and a Revolute, to reach around
Various testing of non-linear elastic bands was conducted with a deep dive into the data analysis

content.header: Manus Arm Robotic Assistant's Arm Lift (MARA aLift)
list: MARA is a robot with 2 belt-driven robotic arms, each containing 6 Dof, fixed onto a mobile base of an additional 2 Dof
aLift added a new Dof to each arm (up/down) to allow MARA to reach higher objects while remaining stable on its base
Project involved worm-gears, gear ratios, ball-screws, roller bearings, as well as 3D printed housing components
Increased the maximum reachable height and work-space by approximately 35%

content.header: Robot and Simulator for End Effector Tracking and Singularity Avoidance
list: Designed a robot with 6 Dof that could pick and place objects with no two identical consecutive joints
Built a prototype which could be manipulated to test range and motion
Programmed a simulator which could show the optimal path and avoid singularity (hitting or passing through itself)
Simulator could test any robot with any number of joints in a single chain, not just the one built in this project

content.header: Active Clothing with Embedded Sensors and Live Monitoring
list: 36-hour project during the MD5 SOFWERX Hackathon involving military clothing with advanced sensors and live data analysis.
Worked with students and other professionals to develop an online system for live responses from a central command center
Theoretical applications involved all branches of the military, professional athletes, and disabled/elderly individuals
Studied the issues that a person with cerebral palsy faces when confronted with routine tasks
Worked with partners to develop a versatile table which could attach to any wheelchair
Printed and fabricated the system with a program developed for testing functionality

content.header: Lab Racing and Distance Sensing Robot
list: Given scrap parts and a shell program, developed and raced a robot which followed a set criterion
Devised a control system which was simpler than the shell program provided with reliable operation
Designed, analyzed, and partially fabricated a food production system with individual capsules for future deep-space missions
The system operates by utilizing Artificial Gravity via centripetal motion and paired with a unique, Golden Ratio-based design

content.header: Quadrotor Design, Automation, and Racing Competitions
list: Established and organized a bi-annual multi-college quadrotor competition focused on drone design and autonomous control
Due to the unique designs of the quadrotor components, most were 3D printed using a lab-built FDM printer
Competitions are still ongoing with more teams, schools, and colleges producing new, unique quadrotor drones

content.header: NASA’s Reduced Gravity Education Flight Program (MicroG NExT Program)
list: Conceived of and constructed a robot to maneuver in zero gravity conditions and manipulate objects simultaneously
Collaborated with teachers and industry experts to determine the best setup for pneumatic control in space
Robot achieved successful maneuverability and control when tested on NASA's reduced-gravity aircraft, the Vomit Comet

content.header: Theta Tau Coed Professional Engineering Fraternity

list: Collected dues, established payment plans, paid national fees, and ran financial audits
Verified all budgets for each fraternity-sponsored event before they could be approved
Kept careful record of all transactions done by any member using chapter funds
Set up a new member education manual to teach national and local fraternity history and values
Hosted weekly meetings to ensure a timely pledging process completion and instill self-confidence
Mediated in disagreements between new members as well as active brothers
Organized appealing events for brothers and new members to bond at on a personal level
Worked with the treasurer and assigned committee to create and pass budgets for each event
Orchestrated two weeks of casual and professional events to attract potential new members
Participated in elected-board meetings and proposed several mid-semester recruitment events
Established the first professional engineering society on campus, still active and growing today
Began a quadrotor competition between neighboring colleges for various drone applications
Set up a working lab to modify, test, and fabricate parts for drones and other future robots

values: Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA & CalOSHA)
Environmental Protection Agency (US EPA, CalEPA & EU EPA)
Bay Area Air Quality Mgmt District (BAAQMD)
Hazardous Waste and Emergency Response standard

H. Zhao, J. Xie, T. Liang, A. Mao, A. Wang, Y. Chen, D. Ma, V. Paley, A.A. Volinsky. Effects of Thickness Ratios and Sputtering Mode on the Structural, Electrical and Optical Properties of Bilayer Molybdenum Thin Films. AIP Advances, 8(9), 2018. https://doi.org/10.1063/1.5043437

C. Zhang, B. Lu, H. Wang, Z. Guo, V. Paley, A.A. Volinsky. Vacuum Pressureless Sintering of Ti-6Al-4V Alloy with Full Densification and Forged-Like Mechanical Properties. Journal of Materials Engineering and Performance, 27(1), 2018. https://doi.org/10.1007/s11665-017-3019-6
